A Night of Adventure is an American crime film first released on 9th June 1944, directed by Gordon Douglas. Cinematography was by Frank Redman and the film was scored by Leigh Harline. It is based on a play by Wilhelm Speyer and stars Tom Conway, Audrey Long, Edward Brophy, Louis Borel and Addison Richards. 

Tom Conway, who usually plays "the Falcon," is doing a little extracurricular detective work in RKO's "A Night of Adventure," which came to the Rialto yesterday. And with the customary suavity of "the Falcon," he is wriggling his way out of a spot in which he himself, a crime lawyer, is suspected in the death of a girl. 

Most of the suspense in the picture is built in a tricky courtroom scene, for which the writer provided a neat bit of syllogistic plot. The rest is a modest imitation of some previous husband-wife detective films, with Audrey Long playing the rather attractive and difficult wife of the great man.
